intro: Spergularia colorata proles purpurea, commonly known as the purple sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or calcareous soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. The species is known for its ability to tolerate arid conditions and is considered a hardy perennial.
